title._content: Mr Simpson talks to an unidentified Chinese family

description._content: ID number: 074105 Date Made: 16 June 1944 Hansa Bay, New Guinea. Mr F Simpson, official war correspondent for the Australian Broadcasting Commission, interviewing a Chinese family who were members of a party of some 90 Chinese captured by the Japanese at Madang. During their captivity they were forced to work a large vegetable garden established in the Potsdam plantation. Rights Info: No known copyright restrictions. This photograph is from the Australian War Memorial's collection www.awm.gov.au Persistent URL: www.awm.gov.au/collection/074105
